required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Robotic Surgery on Post-operative Outcomes of Patients Who Underwent Radical Cystectomy

brief_summary.textblock: Currently, in the treatment of bladder cancer the use of robotics has entered in clinical practice, therefor robotic radical cystectomy with or without reconstruction is offered to patients during counseling procedures, if deemed appropriate and possible. The aim of the study is therefore the long-term evaluation of the peri-post-operative, oncological and functional results of patients undergoing radical cystectomy, both with an open and robotic approach. This study will thus help to clarify the actual impact of robotic surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who will die from bladder cancer
primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to late follow-up, up to 7 years
primary_outcome.description: Bladder Cancer Specific Mortality after surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who will experience bladder cancer recurrence
primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to late follow-up, up to 7 years

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who will die from all causes
primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to late follow-up, up to 7 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who will die from bladder cancer after Robotic Surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to late follow-up, up to 7 years
secondary_outcome.description: Robotic surgery specific impact on survival

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who will experience bladder cancer recurrence after Robotic Surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to late follow-up, up to 7 years
secondary_outcome.description: Robotic surgery specific impact on recurrence

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who will experience surgical complications after Robotic Surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to late follow-up, up to 7 years
secondary_outcome.description: Robotic surgery specific impact on surgical complications

secondary_outcome.measure: Variation in Quality of Life questionnaire after Robotic Surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to late follow-up, up to 7 years
secondary_outcome.description: Robotic surgery specific impact on quality of life according to European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) core quality of life questionnaire (QLQ-C30)

secondary_outcome.measure: Variation in Quality of Life questionnaire according to Urinary diversions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to late follow-up, up to 7 years
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary diversion specific impact on quality of life according to European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) core quality of life questionnaire (QLQ-C30)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who will experience surgical complications according to Urinary diversions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to late follow-up, up to 7 years
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary diversion specific impact on surgical complications

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who will experience bladder cancer recurrence according to Urinary diversions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to late follow-up, up to 7 years
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary diversion specific impact on bladder cancer recurrence

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who will die from bladder cancer according to Urinary diversions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to late follow-up, up to 7 years
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary diversion specific impact on bladder cancer rmortality

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who will die from all causes according to Urinary diversions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to late follow-up, up to 7 years
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary diversion specific impact on all cause mortality after surgery

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent radical cystectomy for bladder cancer in our centre

intervention.description: All the patients enrolled have undergone or will undergo radical cystectomy, with or without lymphadenectomy or urethrectomy All possibles urinary diversion are included, like ileal conduit, neobladder etc...

study_pop.textblock: The study population is made up of patients who underwent radical cystectomy at AOU Careggi, SOD Robotic Urological Surgery, Minimally Invasive and Renal Transplantation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age major or equal 18 years
- Patients who will undergo radical cystectomy
- Consent to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Absence of willingness to participate
- Further refusal to participate to the study
